CRD_Karlach.synopsis: The player approaches Karlach on their third ceremorphosis night at camp.
CRD_Karlach.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as a companion.2. oe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis3_f25994b3-f7e3-4783-be7e-c66b8fd259523. Speak with her.

CRD_Shadowheart.synopsis: Shadowheart confides in the player during the third night that they stop to camp. The expected effects of their tadpole condition have not come to pass, and Shadowheart tries to reason what this might mean. Are they out of the woods, or is this still just the start of something much worse? Hope and disquiet in equal parts.

CRD_Wyll.synopsis: The player talks to Wyll on the third ceremorphosis night at camp.
CRD_Wyll.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Wyll as a companion.2. oe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis3_f25994b3-f7e3-4783-be7e-c66b8fd259523. Speak with him.

CRD_Astarion.synopsis: Astartion starts the dialog lying on his bedroll, looking up at the stars. He's somewhat pensive, reflective, thinking that he might lose the ability to walk in the sun - even if it means ultimately saving his life. He gets up and is complImentary towards us, but he gets uncomfortably close and his compliments have a hungry feel to them. Really he's thinking that later tonight he'll come back and drink our blood. He excuses himself, but he's sure that tonight's the night he's going to feed.

CRD_Laezel.synopsis: Player confronts Lae'zel in camp for the third night of rest. You discuss the solutions in front of you. She is less intense than usual. But she does not like you pointing this out.

CRD_Karlach_19.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_19.text: Let me get one last look at you in case the brain bug  takes us in the night. There. Got it.

CRD_Karlach_22.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_22.text: Hey, soldier. You surprised me. For the best, I suppose. I was getting a little lost.
CRD_Karlach_22.context: NodeContext: Lost in thought, concentrating, then suddenly surprised by the player.

CRD_Karlach_16.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_16.text: I have - had - this old friend. Really old. She must've been around a hundred and forty by the time I met her.

CRD_Karlach_13.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_13.text: Eventine Grantz was her name. Halfling, ran the bakery in my neighbourhood in the Outer City.

CRD_Karlach_24.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_24.text: Went in for a fresh seedloaf once, only to find her sitting on a stool with her head in her hands. I asked her if she was all right.

CRD_Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_34.text: 'I will be,' she said. 'Just tending to my garden of sadness. Things have got rather overgrown.'
CRD_Karlach_34.context: NodeContext: Thoughtfully, getting lost in the memory.

CRD_Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_3.text: I was just a kid, but I knew what she meant. I thought about it a lot while I was in the Hells.

CRD_Karlach_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_20.text: As glad as I am to be free, Avernus is in me still. Less of a garden and more of a... I don't know, a pit. But when I try to look inside, I can't feel anything.

CRD_Karlach_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_4.text: If you're a pit, I'm an oubliette.

CRD_Karlach_26.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_26.text: Hah. I bet I could handle it. If you could handle the void-like Hell maw inside me.

CRD_Karlach_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_5.text: Give it time. You've only been out a short while.

CRD_Karlach_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_25.text: True enough. Don't know why I'm rushing things, except the risk of imminent mind flayerisation. But hey, we've got a cure in the works, right? Right.

CRD_Karlach_7.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_7.text: I don't know. Maybe not nothing. But maybe... maybe nothing I'm ready for.
CRD_Karlach_7.context: NodeContext: Thinking about the feelings she has inside, about her experiences.

CRD_Karlach_15.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_15.text: Thanks for lending me your ear, soldier. I'll unbend it now. But I appreciate it.

CRD_Karlach_0.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_0.text: Don't bother looking in. That's the past. Look to the future.

CRD_Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_30.text: The future. I foresee... sunny days - lots of them. A little place in the city. And more adventures with the likes of you.

CRD_Karlach_27.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_27.text: And you know what? That feels good.

CRD_Karlach_1.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_1.text: Buck up. It seems we might have a cure for the parasite soon.

CRD_Karlach_8.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_8.text: We'd better. Running out of days, aren't we?

CRD_Karlach_21.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_21.text: Then again, I feel pretty good. Strong. You know?

CRD_Karlach_11.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_11.text: I feel the same. In some ways, I've never felt better.

CRD_Karlach_33.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_33.text: Maybe this is how the squiddie fuckers get you. They put a pep in your step, then burst out of your skull when you least expect it.

CRD_Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_10.text: Well. Let no one say we led boring lives, if nothing else.

CRD_Karlach_28.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_28.text: We better get some shut-eye if we're going to face whatever's coming our way tomorrow. At the rate things are going, I expect nothing less than something totally unexpected.

CRD_Karlach_31.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_31.text: But you look pretty good yourself, I have to say. Now - let's get some shut-eye before I say something I regret and lie awake in rictus horror all night.
CRD_Karlach_31.context: NodeContext: Kind of flirty, kind of awkard.

CRD_Karlach_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_17.text: Well... you may feel shitty, but you look pretty good from where I'm standing. Now - let's get some shut-eye before I say something I regret and lie awake in rictus horror all night.
CRD_Karlach_17.context: NodeContext: Kind of flirty, but kind of awkward

CRD_Shadowheart_23.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_23.text: The leader of the pack comes to chat.

CRD_Shadowheart_59.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_59.text: What's on your mind? You must be pleased to have a clear path forward.

CRD_Shadowheart_35.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_35.text: Finally, some good fortune. Come morning, we know what to do.

CRD_Shadowheart_64.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_64.text: The sooner we find the druid Halsin, the better. I can't wait to get rid of this thing in my head.

CRD_Shadowheart_57.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_57.text: The sooner we find this 'Priestess Gut', the better. I can't wait to get rid of this thing in my head.

CRD_Shadowheart_54.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_54.text: I can't wait to get this thing out of my head.

CRD_Shadowheart_83.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_83.text: So what will come next for you, once this is all over?

CRD_Shadowheart_67.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_67.text: Head to Baldur's Gate. Someone's waiting for me.

CRD_Shadowheart_45.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_45.text: Let a girl have some secrets. Was there anything else?

CRD_Shadowheart_58.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_58.text: Use your shared connection. Probe her thoughts.

CRD_Shadowheart_26.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Shadowheart_26.text: *You find a current of hope flowing through her thoughts. She believes you all have a real chance.*

CRD_Shadowheart_90.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Shadowheart_90.text: *She's anxious to find this person in Baldur's Gate. Whoever it is has a strong hold over her, and can give her something she desperately wants...*

CRD_Shadowheart_87.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_87.text: This person in Baldur's Gate must be very important to you.

CRD_Shadowheart_50.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_50.text: Yes, vastly so. But I don't want to talk about her. Not right now.

CRD_Shadowheart_15.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_15.text: It's a beautiful night. I think I'll stay up to enjoy it while I still can. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_2.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_2.text: We should get some rest. Good night.

CRD_Shadowheart_51.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_51.text: The same. These parasites are proving suspiciously benign.

CRD_Shadowheart_61.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_61.text: But suppose I turn... what would you do?

CRD_Shadowheart_40.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_40.text: Maybe I could leave you tied up while I hunted for a cure.

CRD_Shadowheart_95.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_95.text: Anyway, get some rest. Try not to dream about tying me up.

CRD_Shadowheart_62.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_62.text: No hesitations. I'd just end your misery, then and there.

CRD_Shadowheart_5.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_5.text: Wise... though I hope you'd miss me after I'm gone. I think I would, if the positions were reversed.
CRD_Shadowheart_5.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only plays if SH approves of the player for 10 or moreNodeContext: Approving of player's practical answer. Hint of affection towards them also.

CRD_Shadowheart_14.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_14.text: But you're right - if we're to make it through all this, there can be no room for hesitation. You're doing well.

CRD_Shadowheart_78.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_78.text: A firm answer. I'd do the same.

CRD_Shadowheart_43.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_43.text: We'll need that kind of thinking to make it through all this. You're doing well.

CRD_Shadowheart_8.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_8.text: Let's not do this. I don't like hypothetical questions.

CRD_Shadowheart_86.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_86.text: It's hardly hypothetical - we're still in danger, after all.

CRD_Shadowheart_74.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_74.text: If you turned into a monster? I'd run away.

CRD_Shadowheart_29.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_29.text: Hah! And I'd chase you as fast as my tentacles could carry me.

CRD_Shadowheart_16.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_16.text: It's a beautiful night. I think I'll stay up to enjoy it while I still can. Rest well.
CRD_Shadowheart_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glancing up at the night sky.

CRD_Shadowheart_76.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_76.text: We should get some rest. Good night.

CRD_Shadowheart_79.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_79.text: You know, this could be our last night together.

CRD_Shadowheart_37.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_37.text: I hadn't thought of that. What do you have in mind?

CRD_Shadowheart_84.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_84.text: We could find somewhere discreet right now... away from the camp.

CRD_Shadowheart_94.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_94.text: Hmmm... Brambles on bare skin aren't as fun in practice, I'm afraid.

CRD_Shadowheart_77.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_77.text: Perhaps we should wait for more comfortable surrounds.

CRD_Shadowheart_36.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_36.text: Besides, I can't afford to tire you out - we still have work to do. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_52.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_52.text: Probably wise to just get some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_11.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_11.text: How about a few songs around the fire with the others?

CRD_Shadowheart_7.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_7.text: Ah... that sounds... interesting. But on second thought, I'm quite tired.

CRD_Shadowheart_30.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_30.text: Perhaps something else will come to you, before we part ways. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_55.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_55.text: Is she serious? Probe her thoughts using your shared connection.

CRD_Shadowheart_25.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Shadowheart_25.text: *She is serious. Even she seems surprised. She's attracted to you...*

CRD_Shadowheart_73.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Shadowheart_73.text: *... but you sense more - a warm swell of embarrassment.*

CRD_Shadowheart_48.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_48.text: Once this is all over, we should find a tavern and celebrate properly.

CRD_Shadowheart_88.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_88.text: Heh. A little comfort and company doesn't sound bad...

CRD_Shadowheart_66.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_66.text: ...but let's take care of our problem first. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_42.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_42.context: NodeContext: Sharp anger. The player stepped over a boundary (tried to read her thoughts).

CRD_Shadowheart_89.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_89.context: NodeContext: Cursed thing = tadpole. Player's attempted mindmeld caused her some discomfort.

CRD_Shadowheart_17.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_17.text: Do that again, and I'll split your skull, understand?

CRD_Shadowheart_6.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_6.text: I just want to know how you really feel.

CRD_Shadowheart_21.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_21.text: If I want you to know something, I'll tell you.

CRD_Shadowheart_33.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_33.text: Do what again? What are you talking about?

CRD_Shadowheart_3.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_3.text: Keep this up, and I'm out of here.

CRD_Shadowheart_72.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_72.text: I had to be sure I could still trust you.

CRD_Shadowheart_4.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_4.text: Hmmm... you'd do well where I'm from. But don't try it again.

CRD_Shadowheart_49.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_49.text: Now go rest. And keep your mind to yourself.

CRD_Shadowheart_82.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_82.text: At least you're honest. Don't do that again.

CRD_Shadowheart_85.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_85.text: Stop! I already warned you not to do that again.

CRD_Shadowheart_68.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_68.text: I can't trust you, can I?

CRD_Shadowheart_46.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_46.text: The sooner we part ways, the better. Until then, keep away from me.

CRD_Shadowheart_9.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_9.text: I hope not. I'd miss our little conversations... wouldn't you miss them as well?

CRD_Shadowheart_38.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_38.text: I have enjoyed your company, yes.

CRD_Shadowheart_13.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_13.text: I'm glad. Hopefully we can eke out some more time together, before all's done and dusted...

CRD_Shadowheart_0.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_0.text: We're just working towards a common goal. Don't get sentimental.

CRD_Shadowheart_96.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_96.text: That's not something I'm accused of very often... but I suppose you're right. I'll let you get your rest - good night.
CRD_Shadowheart_96.context: NodeContext: A little surprised, but she can't fault the player's lack of sentiment.

CRD_Shadowheart_60.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_60.text: No. I just want to put all this behind me.

CRD_Shadowheart_20.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_20.text: Oh. In that case, I won't keep you from your blanket. The time in my company will pass more quickly if you're asleep. Good night.
CRD_Shadowheart_20.context: NodeContext: A little wounded and frosty.

CRD_Shadowheart_31.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_31.text: Journey's not over yet. We should both get some rest.

CRD_Wyll_17.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_17.text: This might sound presumptuous, but I hope we'll stay allies once we're cured.

CRD_Wyll_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_4.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves, we haven't 'cured' anything yet.

CRD_Wyll_12.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_12.text: Oh, Astarion. I bet I'd find a touch of sweet under all that sour, if I digged deep enough.

CRD_Wyll_2.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_2.text: So deep, in fact, that I'd probably need more than one shovel.

CRD_Wyll_15.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_15.text: Now, let's rest. I wager tomorrow'll be a big day.

CRD_Wyll_1.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_1.text: You've shown me the kind of man you are. I'll call you a friend for as long as you'll have me.

CRD_Wyll_5.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_5.text: I'm glad to hear that Karlach. Who would have thought my prey might become a good partner instead?

CRD_Wyll_8.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_8.text: My duty is to Queen Vlaakith. I'll be leaving this place as soon as I'm able.

CRD_Wyll_18.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_18.text: A shame. A warrior of your merits could cleanse the Coast of its monsters, and still have time to hunt supper.

CRD_Wyll_10.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_10.text: I hope your queen values the treasure she has in you.

CRD_Wyll_11.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_11.text: That sounds great. The more friends the better.

CRD_Wyll_3.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_3.text: Friends it is. When your storms gather and lightning strikes, I'll come calling.

CRD_Wyll_6.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_6.text: Now, let's rest. I wager tomorrow'll be a big day.

CRD_Wyll_9.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_9.text: 'Maybe' is better than 'no' last I checked. I'll take it.

CRD_Wyll_19.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_19.text: No thanks. I'll be going my own way.

CRD_Wyll_7.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_7.text: Then I hope the road rises to meet you, wherever it leads.

CRD_Narrator_6.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_6.text: *The dark clouds of your imagination part, and a speck of hope shines through.*

CRD_Narrator_4.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_4.text: *You feel as healthy as ever - healthier than the day before, in fact. You will reach a crèche, and you will be purified. You're certain of it.*

CRD_Narrator_3.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_3.text: *The druid Halsin sounds like a remarkable talent. He can still the parasite, you're sure of it.*

CRD_Narrator_2.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_2.text: *A goblin priestess seems an unlikely ally, but you have faith she can destroy the tadpole in your brain.*

CRD_Narrator_8.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_8.text: *Lae'zel's promised purification at a githyanki crèche. And she's given you no reason to disbelieve her.*

CRD_Narrator_1.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_1.text: *Great wisdom lies behind Auntie Ethel's kind eyes. She can heal your infection, you're certain.*

CRD_Narrator_7.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_7.text: *A smile threatens to curl your lip. A cure is on the horizon. Soon, you'll be rid of this tadpole for good.*

CRD_Narrator_5.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_5.text: *You feel as healthy as ever - healthier than the day before, in fact. Maybe the parasite is... broken, or dying...*

CRD_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_0.text: *...maybe you've got more time to find a cure than you thought.*

CRD_Astarion_58.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_58.text: Do you mind? I was rather enjoying my view of the ceiling.
CRD_Astarion_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Astarion, who is lying on his bedroll, thinking. He is not looking at the stars

CRD_Astarion_47.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_47.text: It's something of a novelty. I'm usually quite busy at night, but now I'm just lying here and thinking.

CRD_Astarion_6.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_6.text: Pardon, I didn't mean to disturb such important work.

CRD_Astarion_9.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_9.text: I'll forgive you. I'm mostly just thinking anyway.

CRD_Astarion_25.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_25.text: The stars, I mean. I could take or leave your chin.

CRD_Astarion_63.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_63.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we find the druid.

CRD_Astarion_43.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_43.text: Will he know how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

CRD_Astarion_5.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_5.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we meet this goblin priestess.

CRD_Astarion_2.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_2.text: Will she know how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

CRD_Astarion_28.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_28.text: It doesn't have to be. We can still travel together.

CRD_Astarion_78.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_78.text: Good! I don't want you to run off just yet.

CRD_Astarion_8.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_8.text: Probably. Once the worm is gone, I'm going my own way.

CRD_Astarion_62.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_62.text: You're quite the ally, after all. Traversing Avernus. Surviving the crash. Surviving everything that's followed...

CRD_Astarion_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_13.text: You've been to the Hells and back. Survived the crash. Survived everything that's followed.

CRD_Astarion_59.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_59.text: I'm not easily impressed by people, but you're stronger than I gave you credit for.
CRD_Astarion_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion approaches towards the player, getting a little too close. [reuse]

CRD_Astarion_61.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_61.text: You have your charms... more than you think.

CRD_Astarion_51.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Astarion_51.text: *The smile on his pretty lips is a touch too composed, a bit too perfect. He may not mean a word he says.*

CRD_Astarion_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_4.text: Perhaps we should get to know one another better...

CRD_Astarion_55.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_55.text: I thought you didn't like me.

CRD_Astarion_23.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_23.text: I'm just trying to survive. Like you.

CRD_Astarion_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_26.text: Yes, we're more similar than I thought...

CRD_Astarion_80.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_80.text: Hmm? Oh, I was leagues away. I just need to...

CRD_Astarion_75.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_75.text: I'll see you later, I'm sure. Sleep tight.
CRD_Astarion_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion lies back down on his bedroll [reuse]NodeContext: He's thinking about sneaking back into camp and drinking your blood tonight. Sleep tight should be said with a smirk.

CRD_Astarion_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_56.text: ...I just need to get some air. Clear my head.

CRD_Astarion_39.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_39.text: Just don't try to bite me again. It won't go well for you.

CRD_Astarion_34.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_34.text: Heavens forbid. I've learned my lesson. I just...

CRD_Astarion_36.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_36.text: Sleep tight. I'll see you later, I'm sure.
CRD_Astarion_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Player turns and walks away. [reuse]NodeContext: Called after someone walking away.

CRD_Astarion_16.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_16.text: I have many talents. If you want to explore them...

CRD_Astarion_70.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_70.text: But? What are you waiting for?

CRD_Astarion_30.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_30.text: ...I'm sorry, I - I need to clear my head.

CRD_Astarion_72.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_72.text: Hmm? Yes! Of course, me too.

CRD_Astarion_64.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_64.text: I think I'll just - just clear my head.

CRD_Astarion_67.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_67.text: Just keep your eyes away from my neck.

CRD_Astarion_45.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: He doesn't move.NodeContext: Smug, quiet, he's still right in her face.

CRD_Astarion_49.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_49.text: I was just going anyway. I need to clear my head.
CRD_Astarion_49.context: NodeContext: Smug, quiet, he's still right in her face.

CRD_Astarion_21.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_21.text: I'm sure I'll see you when I get back. Sleep tight.
CRD_Astarion_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~He steps back with a smug smile, then turns and leaves. [reuse]

CRD_Astarion_54.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_54.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we arrive at this gith crèche.

CRD_Astarion_37.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_37.text: Will we find out how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

CRD_Astarion_46.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_46.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we get to this hag's teahouse.

CRD_Astarion_69.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_69.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring.

CRD_Astarion_40.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_40.text: I can see the stars from Baldur's Gate, of course, but not with such clarity. It got me thinking.

CRD_Laezel_21.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_21.text: G'lyck. I remember who I was in Crèche K'liir.
CRD_Laezel_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looking pensively at the ceiling

CRD_Laezel_43.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_43.text: I was hungry to face my first ghaik, my sword pined for their blood.

CRD_Laezel_44.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_44.text: A fine evening, don't you think?
CRD_Laezel_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Laezel is looking upward to the sky [lookats]NodeContext: She should sound sincere to begin with, but she twists this around on the third line

CRD_Laezel_15.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_15.text: The moonlight shines warmly on us. The breeze caresses our faces.

CRD_Laezel_41.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_41.text: Would that I were doing battle up there, among the Tears.
CRD_Laezel_41.context: NodeContext: Tears = the kind you cry

CRD_Laezel_38.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_38.text: What do you mean by 'the Tears'?

CRD_Laezel_46.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_46.text: Look above. Watch the moon cross the sky.

CRD_Laezel_2.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_2.text: Next time you're able, look to the sky, watch the moon cross it.

CRD_Laezel_1.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_1.text: The Tears follow behind it. Rocky bodies tumbling through the Sea of Night. One of them is my crèche: K'liir.

CRD_Laezel_3.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_3.text: Are all githyanki from the Tears?

CRD_Laezel_30.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_30.text: Your curiosity is to be commended.

CRD_Laezel_37.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_37.text: Githyanki are hatched in crèches all throughout Realmspace. K'liir is one of many.

CRD_Laezel_6.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_6.text: It's there I first saw a kith'rak mount a red dragon. Where I slit my cousins' throats at the varsh's command.

CRD_Laezel_4.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_4.text: But enough of this. You are wasting your resting time. Come dawn, we resume our search for a crèche.
CRD_Laezel_4.context: NodeContext: Begin line with a sigh

CRD_Laezel_51.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_51.text: It must be quite a shock, to leave your crèche behind and arrive here.

CRD_Laezel_50.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_50.text: Do you think me so sheltered?

CRD_Laezel_17.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_17.text: My entire clutch battled beholders deep within the Eye of the Sky.

CRD_Laezel_39.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_39.text: We infiltrated a neogi Spelljammer and laid waste to its crew.

CRD_Laezel_23.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_23.text: The Tears span Toril's sky, vin'iisk. There is more to this realm than this grassy pebble.

CRD_Laezel_25.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_25.text: Did you only train within the Tears?

CRD_Laezel_19.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_19.text: My entire clutch battled beholders within the Eye of the Sky's tunnels.

CRD_Laezel_11.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_11.text: We infiltrated a neogi spelljammer and laid waste to its crew.

CRD_Laezel_29.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_29.text: The Tears span Toril's sky. There is more to the realm than this grassy pebble, vin'iisk.

CRD_Laezel_28.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_28.text: You mean you come from up there? In the sky?

CRD_Laezel_10.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_10.text: You are too easily astonished. There is more to this realm than this grassy pebble.

CRD_Laezel_32.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_32.text: Faerûn isn't so bad. Give it a chance.

CRD_Laezel_47.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_47.text: I see naught but cowards cowering in their groves and grottos.

CRD_Laezel_42.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_42.text: Flowering meadows and fecund soil have softened their minds and muscles.

CRD_Laezel_27.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_27.text: They rely on strangers' swords, when they should be forging their own.

CRD_Laezel_45.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_45.text: You want to do battle up where?

CRD_Laezel_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_12.text: The Tears of Selûne? They mar the sky - I'd extinguish them if I could.

CRD_Laezel_5.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_5.text: Extinguish the Tears? Your dedication to your goddess blinds you to their import.

CRD_Laezel_13.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_13.text: The Tears of Selûne, you mean?

CRD_Laezel_7.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_7.text: Yes. Rocky bodies named after a false goddess.

CRD_Laezel_8.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_8.text: The Tears of Selûne? I've spent many a night observing these celestial bodies.

CRD_Laezel_9.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_9.text: Perhaps we may see them this eve. Look above, to the Sea of Night.

CRD_Laezel_36.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_36.text: Should you be fortunate, you may see Crèche K'liir tumble past.

CRD_Laezel_34.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_34.text: Then perhaps you've unknowingly gazed at my crèche, K'liir, as it tumbled past.

CRD_Laezel_48.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_48.text: You are wise not to waste your resting time. Come dawn, we resume our search for a crèche.

CRD_Laezel_49.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_49.text: G'lyck. Sleeping in a cave reminds me of my adolescence - in Crèche K'liir.
CRD_Laezel_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looking resentfully at the ceiling
